description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to improve the health and hygiene practices in order to reduce the spread of cholera and strengthen the institutional capacity to respond to outbreaks. The Project is financing two Components: (i) Support to the Government’s Response to Cholera at the Decentralized Level; and (ii) Emergency Response Capacity Building.

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall appoint, or cause FAES to appoint, not later than four (4) months after the Effective Date, the independentauditors referred to in Section 4.09 (b) (i) of the General Condit.
The Recipient shall cause FAES to amend and update the Project Operation Manual in a manner satisfactory to the Association, toreflect the implementation arrangements in respect of this Project.
The Recipient shall cause FAES to recruit an accountant for the Project, with terms of reference, qualifications and experiencesatisfactory to the Association and in accordance with the provisio
The Recipient shall prepare and disclose in a manner satisfactory to the Association the Environmental and Social ManagementFramework, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association
The Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Recipient and FAES

title.narrative: Number of people receiving water treatment products and soap

comment.narrative: Indicator met and surpassed.

title.narrative: Establishment and functioning of one national and five regional Cholera and Emergency Response Units

comment.narrative: Government has decided to recruit cholera coordinators in the departments rather than create new units. Thus, this indicatorreflects the number of coordinators in place.
A national cholera focal point is in place and 6 departmental cholera focal points are in place.

title.narrative: Percentage of population in project intervention areas who know the cholera early warning symptoms and prevention steps

comment.narrative: Identification of Symptoms: 64%Knowledge of Prevention Steps: 13%. Baseline has changed as a result of an harmonizedconsolidation of the two phases and to make it consistent with endline.
Identification of Symptoms: 69%Knowledge of Prevention Steps: 18%
Identification of Symptoms: 82%Knowledge of Prevention Steps: 14%.

title.narrative: Departmental Cholera Management Plan developed (by MSPP and DINEPA) for at least five departments

comment.narrative: N/A
Indicator achieved and surpassed.

title.narrative: Good quality quarterly IFRs are submitted to the Bank in a timely manner

comment.narrative: N/A
Indicator not achieved
One more IFR may be submitted before the end of the Project

title.narrative: Quarterly project progress reports submitted to Cholera Coordination Committee and to Bank

comment.narrative: N/A
The indicators was met and surpass
Project progress was reported in aide-memoires circulated to MSPP at the central and decentralized level, DINEPA and all partnersand submitted to the Bank.

title.narrative: Percentage of population in project intervention areas with access to improved water sources

comment.narrative: Note: The original indicator “improved water source or treated water” was measured in the survey as the percentage of householdsthat treat/chlorinate their drinking water regularly.
The project did not aim at facilitating improvement of water sources. To this end, the project is, in effect, sustaining access toclean water.

A preliminary indicator was used before but it was updated to be appropriately measured. Also sound methodology was ensured tomakeit consistent with end-line. The final baseline was only submitted by CRD in June 2013 and its final report in August 2013.

title.narrative: Number of communities that have received targeted health education and/or prevention activities

comment.narrative: "Localities" is being used in the place of communities, given the Haitian context.
Indicators met and surpassed

title.narrative: Increased institutional capacity as measured by achievement of at least four out of five of Component 2 indicators on an annual basis

comment.narrative: Four out of five indicators achieved.
Four out of five indicators achieved.

title.narrative: Number of personnel and community workers trained (by type of training)

comment.narrative: The previous ISR had as target the number of planned facilities corresponding to the implementation plan submitted in the firstsemester of 2012. To make it consistent with the other intermediary indicators, we have changed for the baseline set in 2011, whichwasused thereafter in subsequent aide-memoires
Indicator met and surpassed.

title.narrative: Number of health centers and posts, treatment and chlorination centers and units, and oral rehydration posts supported with supplies

comment.narrative: The previous ISR had as target the number of planned facilities corresponding to the implementation plan submitted in the firstsemester of 2012. To make it consistent with the other intermediary indicators, we have changed for the baseline set in 2011, whichwasused thereafter in subsequent aide-memoires

This indicators has been met. Changes in the cholera response strategy by the MSPP, which does not support any longer permanentstand-alone cholera rehydration posts. The hydration posts are part of the emergency response and are put in place in case ofoutbreak.
